name: grumble
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to complain about someone or something in an annoyed way: grumble about She spent the evening grumbling to me about her job. [ + speech ] "You never hang your coat up," she grumbled.
Thesaurus: synonyms, antonyms, and examples
to say something is not right or satisfactorycomplainI hate to complain, but the film was terrible.grumbleShe's always grumbling about something.whineI hope you don't think I'm just whining.kvetchStop kvetching about it!make a fussIf the food doesn't come soon, I'm going to make a fuss.file a complaintI've filed a complaint with the police about the noise.
See more results »
If your stomach grumbles, it makes a low, continuous noise, usually because you are hungry.

a complaint: When the teacher assigned extra homework, she heard a few grumbles from the kids.

to complain in an annoyed way: There’s no point in grumbling about the hotel – we’re only here for one night.
